# Usage

<!-- This is generated by scripts/generate-usage.sh. Don't edit this file directly. -->

```console
$ khulnasoft help
NAME:
   khulnasoft - Version Manager of CLI. https://khulnasoftproj.github.io/

USAGE:
   khulnasoft [global options] command [command options] [arguments...]

VERSION:
   2.10.0 (b80f805489c317d83d7fe0b182f3ef5c82a06725)

COMMANDS:
   init                   Create a configuration file if it doesn't exist
   info                   Show information
   init-policy            [Deprecated] Create a policy file if it doesn't exist
   policy                 Manage Policy
   install, i             Install tools
   update-khulnasoft            Update khulnasoft
   generate, g            Search packages in registries and output the configuration interactively
   which                  Output the absolute file path of the given command
   exec                   Execute tool
   list                   List packages in Registries
   generate-registry, gr  Generate a registry's package configuration
   completion             Output shell completion script for bash or zsh
   version                Show version
   cp                     Copy executable files in a directory
   root-dir               Output the khulnasoft root directory (KHULNASOFT_ROOT_DIR)
   update-checksum        Create or Update khulnasoft-checksums.json
   help, h                Shows a list of commands or help for one command

GLOBAL OPTIONS:
   --log-level value         log level [$KHULNASOFT_LOG_LEVEL]
   --config value, -c value  configuration file path [$KHULNASOFT_CONFIG]
   --trace value             trace output file path
   --cpu-profile value       cpu profile output file path
   --help, -h                show help
   --version, -v             print the version
```

## khulnasoft install

```console
$ khulnasoft help install
NAME:
   khulnasoft install - Install tools

USAGE:
   khulnasoft install [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Install tools according to the configuration files.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft i

   If you want to create only symbolic links and want to skip downloading package, please set "-l" option.

   $ khulnasoft i -l

   By default khulnasoft doesn't install packages in the global configuration.
   If you want to install packages in the global configuration too,
   please set "-a" option.

   $ khulnasoft i -a

   You can filter installed packages with package tags.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft i -t foo # Install only packages having a tag "foo"
   $ khulnasoft i --exclude-tags foo # Install only packages not having a tag "foo"


OPTIONS:
   --only-link, -l         create links but skip downloading packages (default: false)
   --test                  This flag was deprecated and had no meaning from khulnasoft v2.0.0. This flag will be removed in khulnasoft v3.0.0. https://github.com/khulnasoftproj/khulnasoft/issues/1691 (default: false)
   --all, -a               install all khulnasoft configuration packages (default: false)
   --tags value, -t value  filter installed packages with tags
   --exclude-tags value    exclude installed packages with tags
   --help, -h              show help
```

## khulnasoft generate

```console
$ khulnasoft help generate
NAME:
   khulnasoft generate - Search packages in registries and output the configuration interactively

USAGE:
   khulnasoft generate [command options] [<registry name>,<package name> ...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Search packages in registries and output the configuration interactively.

   If no argument is passed, interactive fuzzy finder is launched.

   $ khulnasoft g

     influxdata/influx-cli (standard) (influx)                     ┌ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ 
     newrelic/newrelic-cli (standard) (newrelic)                   │  cli/cli
     pivotal-cf/pivnet-cli (standard) (pivnet)                     │
     scaleway/scaleway-cli (standard) (scw)                        │  https://cli.github.com/
     tfmigrator/cli (standard) (tfmigrator)                        │  GitHub’cs official command line tool
     aws/copilot-cli (standard) (copilot)                          │
     codeclimate/test-reporter (standard)                          │
     create-go-app/cli (standard) (cgapp)                          │
     harness/drone-cli (standard) (drone)                          │
     sigstore/rekor (standard) (rekor-cli)                         │
     getsentry/sentry-cli (standard)                               │
     knative/client (standard) (kn)                                │
     rancher/cli (standard) (rancher)                              │
     tektoncd/cli (standard) (tkn)                                 │
     civo/cli (standard) (civo)                                    │
     dapr/cli (standard) (dapr)                                    │
     mongodb/mongocli (standard)                                   │
     openfaas/faas-cli (standard)                                  │
   > cli/cli (standard) (gh)                                       │
     48/380                                                        │
   > cli                                                           └ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ ─ 

   Please select the package you want to install, then the package configuration is outptted.
   You can select multiple packages by tab key.
   Please copy and paste the outputted configuration in the khulnasoft configuration file.

   $ khulnasoft g # tfmigrator/cli is selected
   - name: tfmigrator/cli@v0.2.1

   You can update the configuration file directly with "-i" option.

   $ khulnasoft g -i

   You can update an imported file with "-o" option.

   $ khulnasoft g -o khulnasoft/pkgs.yaml

   You can pass packages with positional arguments.

   $ khulnasoft g [<registry name>,<package name>[@<version>] ...]

   $ khulnasoft g standard,cli/cli standard,junegunn/fzf standard,sulaiman-coder/tfcmt@v3.0.0
   - name: cli/cli@v2.2.0
   - name: junegunn/fzf@0.28.0
   - name: sulaiman-coder/tfcmt@v3.0.0

   You can omit the registry name if it is "standard".

   $ khulnasoft g cli/cli
   - name: cli/cli@v2.2.0

   With "-f" option, you can pass packages.

   $ khulnasoft g -f packages.txt # list of <registry name>,<package name>
   - name: cli/cli@v2.2.0
   - name: junegunn/fzf@0.28.0
   - name: tfmigrator/cli@v0.2.1

   $ cat packages.txt | khulnasoft g -f -
   - name: cli/cli@v2.2.0
   - name: junegunn/fzf@0.28.0
   - name: tfmigrator/cli@v0.2.1

   $ khulnasoft list | khulnasoft g -f - # Generate configuration to install all packages

   You can omit the registry name if it is "standard".

   echo "cli/cli" | khulnasoft g -f -
   - name: cli/cli@v2.2.0

   You can select a version interactively with "-s" option.

   $ khulnasoft g -s

   The option "-pin" is useful to prevent the package from being updated by Renovate.

   $ khulnasoft g -pin cli/cli
   - name: cli/cli
     version: v2.2.0

   With -detail option, khulnasoft outputs additional information such as description and link.

   $ khulnasoft g -detail cli/cli
   - name: cli/cli@v2.2.0
     description: GitHub’s official command line tool
     link: https://github.com/cli/cli


OPTIONS:
   -f value              the file path of packages list. When the value is "-", the list is passed from the standard input
   -i                    Insert packages to configuration file (default: false)
   --pin                 Pin version (default: false)
   --detail, -d          Output additional fields such as description and link (default: false) [$KHULNASOFT_GENERATE_WITH_DETAIL]
   -o value              inserted file
   --select-version, -s  Select the installed version interactively (default: false)
   --help, -h            show help
```

## khulnasoft init

```console
$ khulnasoft help init
NAME:
   khulnasoft init - Create a configuration file if it doesn't exist

USAGE:
   khulnasoft init [command options] [<created file path. The default value is "khulnasoft.yaml">]

DESCRIPTION:
   Create a configuration file if it doesn't exist
   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft init # create "khulnasoft.yaml"
   $ khulnasoft init foo.yaml # create foo.yaml

OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help
```

## khulnasoft update-khulnasoft

```console
$ khulnasoft help update-khulnasoft
NAME:
   khulnasoft update-khulnasoft - Update khulnasoft

USAGE:
   khulnasoft update-khulnasoft [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Update khulnasoft.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft update-khulnasoft [version]

   khulnasoft is installed in $KHULNASOFT_ROOT_DIR/bin.
   By default the latest version of khulnasoft is installed, but you can specify the version with argument.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft update-khulnasoft # Install the latest version
   $ khulnasoft update-khulnasoft v1.20.0 # Install v1.20.0


OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help
```

## khulnasoft update-checksum

```console
$ khulnasoft help update-checksum
NAME:
   khulnasoft update-checksum - Create or Update khulnasoft-checksums.json

USAGE:
   khulnasoft update-checksum [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Create or Update khulnasoft-checksums.json.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft update-checksum

   By default khulnasoft doesn't update khulnasoft-checksums.json of the global configuration.
   If you want to update them too,
   please set "-a" option.

   $ khulnasoft update-checksum -a

   By default, khulnasoft update-checksum doesn't remove existing checksums even if they aren't unused.
   If -prune option is set, khulnasoft unused checksums would be removed.

   $ khulnasoft update-checksum -prune


OPTIONS:
   --all, -a   Create or Update all khulnasoft-checksums.json including global configuration (default: false)
   --deep      This flag was deprecated and had no meaning from khulnasoft v2.0.0. This flag will be removed in khulnasoft v3.0.0. https://github.com/khulnasoftproj/khulnasoft/issues/1769 (default: false)
   --prune     Remove unused checksums (default: false)
   --help, -h  show help
```

## khulnasoft which

```console
$ khulnasoft help which
NAME:
   khulnasoft which - Output the absolute file path of the given command

USAGE:
   khulnasoft which [command options] <command name>

DESCRIPTION:
   Output the absolute file path of the given command
   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft which gh
   /home/foo/.khulnasoft/pkgs/github_release/github.com/cli/cli/v2.4.0/gh_2.4.0_macOS_amd64.tar.gz/gh_2.4.0_macOS_amd64/bin/gh

   If the command isn't found in the configuration files, khulnasoft searches the command in the environment variable PATH

   $ khulnasoft which ls
   /bin/ls

   If the command isn't found, exits with non zero exit code.

   $ khulnasoft which foo
   FATA[0000] khulnasoft failed                                   khulnasoft_version=0.8.6 error="command is not found" exe_name=foo program=khulnasoft


OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help
```

## khulnasoft generate-registry

```console
$ khulnasoft help generate-registry
NAME:
   khulnasoft generate-registry - Generate a registry's package configuration

USAGE:
   khulnasoft generate-registry [command options] <package name>

DESCRIPTION:
   Generate a template of Registry package configuration.

   Note that you probably fix the generate code manually.
   The generate code is not perfect and may include the wrong configuration.
   It is just a template.

   e.g.

   $ khulnasoft gr cli/cli # Outputs the configuration.
   packages:
     - type: github_release
       repo_owner: cli
       repo_name: cli
       asset: gh_{{trimV .Version}}_{{.OS}}_{{.Arch}}.{{.Format}}
       format: tar.gz
       description: GitHub’s official command line tool
       replacements:
         darwin: macOS
       overrides:
         - goos: windows
           format: zip
       supported_envs:
         - darwin
         - linux
         - amd64
       rosetta2: true

   By default, khulnasoft gets the information from the latest GitHub Releases.
   You can specify a specific package version.

   e.g.

   $ khulnasoft gr cli/cli@v2.0.0

   By default, khulnasoft gr doesn't generate version_overrides.
   If --deep is set, khulnasoft generates version_overrides.

   e.g.

   $ khulnasoft gr --deep sulaiman-coder/tfcmt

   Note that if --deep is set, GitHub API is called per GitHub Release.
   This may cause GitHub API rate limiting.

   If --out-testdata is set, khulnasoft inserts testdata into the specified file.

   e.g.

   $ khulnasoft gr --out-testdata testdata.yaml sulaiman-coder/tfcmt


OPTIONS:
   --out-testdata value  A file path where the testdata is outputted
   --deep                Resolve version_overrides (default: false)
   --help, -h            show help
```

## khulnasoft cp

```console
$ khulnasoft help cp
NAME:
   khulnasoft cp - Copy executable files in a directory

USAGE:
   khulnasoft cp [command options] <command name> [<command name> ...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Copy executable files in a directory.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft cp gh
   $ ls dist
   gh

   You can specify the target directory by -o option.

   $ khulnasoft cp -o ~/bin terraform hugo

   If you don't specify commands, all commands are copied.

   $ khulnasoft cp

   You can also copy global configuration files' commands with "-a" option.

   $ khulnasoft cp -a

   You can filter copied commands with package tags.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft cp -t foo # Copy only packages having a tag "foo"
   $ khulnasoft cp --exclude-tags foo # Copy only packages not having a tag "foo"


OPTIONS:
   -o value                destination directory
   --all, -a               install all khulnasoft configuration packages (default: false)
   --tags value, -t value  filter installed packages with tags
   --exclude-tags value    exclude installed packages with tags
   --help, -h              show help
```

## khulnasoft info

```console
$ khulnasoft help info
NAME:
   khulnasoft info - Show information

USAGE:
   khulnasoft info [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Show information.
   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft info

OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help
```

## khulnasoft list

```console
$ khulnasoft help list
NAME:
   khulnasoft list - List packages in Registries

USAGE:
   khulnasoft list [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Output the list of packages in registries.
   The output format is <registry name>,<package name>

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft list
   standard,99designs/aws-vault
   standard,abiosoft/colima
   standard,abs-lang/abs
   ...


OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help
```

## khulnasoft completion

```console
$ khulnasoft help completion
NAME:
   khulnasoft completion - Output shell completion script for bash or zsh

USAGE:
   khulnasoft completion command [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Output shell completion script for bash or zsh
   Run these commands in .bash_profile or .zprofile
   e.g.
   .bash_profile

   if command -v khulnasoft &> /dev/null; then source <(khulnasoft completion bash); fi

   .zprofile

   if command -v khulnasoft &> /dev/null; then source <(khulnasoft completion zsh); fi


```

## khulnasoft exec

```console
$ khulnasoft help exec
NAME:
   khulnasoft exec - Execute tool

USAGE:
   khulnasoft exec [command options] <executed command> [<arg> ...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Basically you don't have to use this command, because this is used by khulnasoft internally. khulnasoft-proxy invokes this command.
   When you execute the command installed by khulnasoft, "khulnasoft exec" is executed internally.

   e.g.
   $ khulnasoft exec -- gh version
   gh version 2.4.0 (2021-12-21)
   https://github.com/cli/cli/releases/tag/v2.4.0

OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help
```
